description: From Russian зэ́к (zɛ́k), probably representing a pronunciation of з/к (z/k), Soviet abbreviation of заключённый каналоармеец (zaključónnyj kanaloarmejec, “prisoner member of the [White Sea–Baltic] Canal army”).

entries.meaning: A prisoner at a Russian prison, especially (historical) at a Soviet labour camp. [from 20th c.]
examples: Every prisoner who recants is a potential influence on other zeks to do likewise.
